snippet: The Adaptive Climbing Group, the brainchild of Kareemah Batts, of Brooklyn, is helping paraclimbers, some of whom have been training for the world championships in Spain next month.
abstract: Adaptive Climbing Group, Brooklyn organization founded by Kareemah Batts, helps amputees battle depression and other issues by learning to rock climb; group has integrated a competitive component, and is training several paraclimbers to compete in the world championships in Spain.
lead_paragraph: The Adaptive Climbing Group, the brainchild of Kareemah Batts, of Brooklyn, is helping paraclimbers, some of whom have been training for the world championships in Spain next month.

headline.seo: Adaptive Climbing Group Trains Amputees at Brooklyn Boulders
headline.main: A Group Lifts Paraclimbers to Higher Goals
headline.print_headline: A Group Lifts Paraclimbers to Higher Goals
